channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Dominic Raab unveils UK's new human rights abuse sanctions regime
item.description: The Foreign Secretary said this afternoon the new sanctions regime will target people responsible for the 'very worst human rights abuses around the world'.

item.title: Man, 30, with PTSD killed himself as he couldn't rejoin military
item.description: Jamie Davis was so 'riddled with guilt' about the deaths and injuries of fellow soldiers he screamed military call signs including 'foxtrot' and 'mandown' in his sleep.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle join video call on equal rights
item.description: The Duke of Sussex, 35, made the comment as he joined wife Meghan Markle, 38, for a video call with young leaders from the Queen's Commonwealth Trust last week.

item.title: Fire engineer didn't think Grenfell Tower cladding dangerous
item.description: A senior fire engineer told the new Grenfell Tower disaster inquiry that she did not think overcladding the tower block would lead to any problems during the refurbishing of the tower in 2012.

item.title: Pictured: British Airways' reopened Heathrow Terminal 5 first-class lounge
item.description: BA has begun reopening its lounges in phases. On July 4, the Galleries First, Galleries South Club and Arrivals lounges at Heathrow T5 opened their doors. But the Concorde Room remains shut.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Big outbreaks inevitable if rules aren't kept to
item.description: Dr David Nabarro, a coronavirus expert at the World Health Organization admitted 'everybody has got to have fun' as lockdown rules loosened last weekend but urged people to be careful.

item.title: Three months of falling UK petrol prices ended in June
item.description: Petrol prices rose 4p-a-litre on average in June, partly due to the price of oil strengthening by more than $6 and supermarkets - praised for cutting prices in previous months - ramping up their charges.

item.title: Is Merthyr Tydfil the UK's new Covid-19 hotspot?
item.description: Welsh officials claim the cluster of cases in the borough of Merthyr Tydfil, linked to an outbreak at the Kepak meat-processing plant (pictured), is 'under constant review'.

item.title: German police arrest ex-head of Wirecard's most profitable unit
item.description: The managing director of Cardsystems Middle East FZ-LLC, a Dubai-based subsidiary of Wirecard, was placed under arrest on suspicion of serious fraud, said prosecutors.

item.title: Coronavirus China: Director denies disease origin in Wuhan lab
item.description: Dr Yuan Zhiming, director of the P4 virus lab in Wuhan, told China's state television station CGTN 'not a mosquito can fly into the building without authorisation'.

item.title: Ex-MI6 chief John Sawers backs barring Huawei from 5G
item.description: Beijing's ambassador Liu Xiaoming said shutting out the company due to the US imposing sanctions would show Britain no longer has an 'independent' policy.

item.title: Drinkers queue for more than an hour as pub beer gardens reopen in Scotland
item.description: Outdoor spaces in pubs and restaurants are now able to open for the first time as part of easing measures in Scotland.

item.title: Virgin Media crashes AGAIN; thousands lose internet access
item.description: Virgin Media tells MailOnline the issue was local to Nottingham and has now been resolved, however, customers are still claiming to have difficulty getting online.

item.title: The Louvre museum reopens its doors after 16-week closure
item.description: The Louvre in Paris opened on Monday after nearly four months of closure, with a restricted number of visitors enjoying a rare chance to view the Mona Lisa without the usual throngs.

item.title: US coronavirus deaths hit 130,000 as Florida's cases DOUBLE in less than two weeks
item.description: Even as states tempered their Fourth of July celebrations, record-setting rolling seven day average case increases were hit in 14 states, with Florida and Texas among the hardest hit.

item.title: Aviation tycoon loses High Court bid to overturn UK lockdown
item.description: Simon Dolan raised more than £200,000 through crowdfunding to launch the claim against Health Secretary Matt Hancock and Education Secretary Gavin Williamson over the lockdown laws.

item.title: Gold mining has stripped nitrogen from Amazon soil, study shows
item.description: A new study from researchers at the University of Leeds has found that gold mining in the Amazon leeches nutrients from the soil and pollutes the surrounding area with mercury.

item.title: Homo erectus could run long distances despite being 'built like a rugby player'
item.description: Researchers from the Natural History Museum examined the ribcage of the famous Homo erectus skeleton Turkana Boy to better understand the species breathing.

item.title: Kate Garraway shares thanks as husband emerges from coma
item.description: Kate Garraway has made a rare appearance on social media to share her gratitude for the support she has received, since revealing her husband Derek Draper has awoken from his coma.

item.title: Make-up artists share contouring tip for slimmer nose with FORK
item.description: TikTok user Ellie Trimarchi, from Sydney, amazed the video sharing app with her simple hack for contouring your nose with a fork, using the prongs as a guide when applying the darker and lighter shades.

item.title: London fox steals loaf of bread and two boxes of eggs from doorstep
item.description: The customer set up cameras on their doorstep in west London after items kept being missed from their food delivery.

item.title: Prince Charles plans to 'dampen' 'sense of royal entitlement'
item.description: Royal author Nigel Cawthorne has claimed that Prince Charles plans to 'dampen a sense of entitlement among royals' as he prepares to become king, He made the comments to The Express.

item.title: How to get a free Costa Coffee is chain reopens 2,000 stores
item.description: The coffee shop, which closed in March amid the coronavirus lockdown, will give all UK customers who download its app 3,000 points, the equivalent to £3 or a free drink, to celebrate reopening.

item.title: Online retailer Shein slammed for selling Islamic prayer mats
item.description: Critics have taken to social media over the past week to share images of the 'disrespectful' rugs while accusing the e-retailer of cultural appropriation.

item.title: Trump launches attack on Bubba Wallace demanding NASCAR star 'apologize' for noose 'hoax'
item.description: President Trump launched an attack on Bubba Wallace, demanding the only Black NASCAR driver apologize to those who supported him when it was reported a noose had been found in his garage stall.

item.title: Farmer says Government isn't doing enough to stop fly-tippers
item.description: Farmer Andrew Ward revealed another pile of waste had been abandoned half-a-mile away in Leadenham, Lincolnshire. Fly-tipping has surged 300 per cent during lockdown.

item.title: Housebuilders Barratt to repay all their furlough money
item.description: Barratt Developments furloughed 6,700 employees, 85 per cent of the builder's workforce, and topped up their salaries leaving them with £27 million to pay back to the government.

item.title: London's City University changes name of its Cass Business School because of slavery links
item.description: The business school was named after the 17th Century merchant in 2002, after a donation from the Sir John Cass foundation, but has now decided to change the name.

item.title: Keir Starmer poses with can of 'Barnard Castle Eye Test' ale
item.description: The Labour leader was seen posing with a can of Brewdog's 'Barnard Castle Eye Test' ale- a reference to Dominic Cummings driving 30 minutes from Durham to Barnard Castle to test his eyesight.

item.title: Zadie Smith portrait is added to National Portrait Gallery
item.description: London's National Portrait Gallery said the 'beautiful and monumental' painting of author Zadie Smith is part of its commitment 'to increase representation of women and black sitters and artists'.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell is transferred from New Hampshire to a New York City jail
item.description: The 58-year-old was arrested on Thursday at a home she recently purchased in rural New Hampshire. She is now in the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.

item.title: Sisters killed in London park found 'entwined' on the ground
item.description: Danyal Hussein, 18, allegedly stabbed Nicole Smallman, 27, and Bibaa Henry, 46, multiple times in the early hours of Saturday June 6 in an 'unprovoked and random attack'.

item.title: Twitter users reflect on the things they'll miss about lockdown
item.description: Twitter users from across the UK and US have been using the hashtag #ThingsIWillMissAboutLockdown to share the positive parts of the coronavirus pandemic that will be missed.

item.title: Lily James heads back to Hollywood star Chris Evans' hotel after glam night out together in London
item.description: English rose Downton Abbey star Lily James has been pictured enjoying a night out in London with Captain America star Chris Evans.

item.title: Boris Johnson shows off drastically shorter hairstyle
item.description: The Prime Minister has taken advantage of restrictions being lifted to get his increasingly wild hair tamed.

item.title: LinkedIn and Reddit remove app code that copies user clipboards
item.description: Reddit, which is the most recent high-profile app to address the practice said that it was using information to suggest a post title based on the contents of a URL copied by a user.

item.title: Cyclists targeted during lockdown with logs and 'nail traps'
item.description: Tom Hayden was leading a group of ten cyclists through Epping Forest when two people walking their dogs allegedly dragged logs into the path.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 15 new fatalities in preliminary death toll
item.description: Department of Health data shows the rolling seven-day average of Covid-19 fatalities in the UK has now dropped to 95 - 20 per cent lower than the 117 for last Monday.

item.title: Yoko Ono, 87, 'still sharp' but 'slowing' and needs 24-hour care
item.description: Since 2017 Yoko Ono, 87, has often been seen outside in wheelchairs but she now rarely leaves her nine-room apartment in The Dakota, New York City.

item.title: Psychologist jailed for life after killing bodybuilder with barbell
item.description: Christopher McDonald, 35, from Croydon, was out on a life licence when he attacked Paul Tong, 54, with an exercise weight at his home in Ealing, west London in 2017.

item.title: Police launch probe into fashion giant Boohoo's Leicester factory
item.description: Priti Patel has stepped in and instructed the National Crime Agency to probe the issues amid claims the factories were operating without social distancing measures in place.

item.title: Gareth Cooper's ex-wife is ordered to pay him back just £1 after swindling him out of £1million
item.description: Former Wales player, 41, had set up two gyms and freight businesses to be run by his wife Debra Leyshon. But she used them to take out mortgages and loans in her husband's name.

item.title: Coronavirus England: NHS and care workers a TENTH of May cases
item.description: A report released today by the Royal Society said that health and care workers in England appear to be a six times higher risk of catching the coronavirus than the general public.

item.title: Duchess of Cornwall wears check dress on visit to Swindon
item.description: Camilla, 72, put on a stylish display in a black and white patterned dress as she visited Swindon Fire Station and Borough Council today.

item.title: Ferrari LOSES legal battle to trademark the shape of 250 GTO
item.description: Ferrari had the shape of the svelte racer trademarked, but the Italian company has lost the right following a legal battle against a bespoke car manufacturer from the same city of Modena.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein's brother calls for murder investigation into death
item.description: Mark Epstein insists his brother pedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein was murdered after a pathologist he hired said he died by 'homicidal strangulation' and not by suicide.

item.title: Former Nazi camp guard, 93, to serve three years in prison
item.description: In what could be one of the last such cases of surviving Nazi guards, Bruno Dey stands accused of complicity in the murder of 5,230 people at the Stutthof camp near what was then Danzig.

item.title: Meghan Markle left Kate Middleton 'upset' with 'rant' at staff
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex, 38, is 'very sensitive' about being 'number two' to Kate Middleton, 38, after joining 'alien environment' of The Firm, royal author Tom Quinn told the Daily Star Online.

item.title: French rock singer Johnny Halliday's widow wins row over his will and pockets £30.7million
item.description: Laeticia Hallyday, 45, the widow of the 'French Elvis' who died in December 2017 aged 74, has inherited the singer's properties, to the estimated value of €28 to €34 million.

item.title: Romanian woman runs for life after posing with BEAR for photo
item.description: A woman in Bacău, Romania, fled in terror as a bear she tried to pose next to for a picture lunged at her. The woman in white and blue managed to escape unharmed.

item.title: Former Lady Diana chef shared the recipe to Prince William and Prince Harry favourite chicken pasta
item.description: Darren McGrady, 58, who cooked for Princess Diana from 1993 to 1997, and is now based in Texas, revealed the recipe for crispy chicken thighs with pasta on his YouTube channel.

item.title: Mother who tandem fed her two daughters and still breastfeeds her daughter, 4
item.description: Natasha Keane, 38, from Galway, practises natural stage weaning - where a child decides for themselves when to stop breastfeeding and is still feeding four-year-old Grace.

item.title: Hawk lands on mating giant tortoises in the Galapagos Islands
item.description: The giant tortoises, who were made famous by Charles Darwin's encounters with them during his voyages, are native to the islands off Ecuador and can live for more than 100 years.

item.title: Ex-MP Charlie Elphicke chanted 'I'm a naughty Tory' as he chased 'horrified' woman around his home
item.description: Former Conservative MP Charlie Elphicke is alleged to have pursued the woman after trying to kiss her at his home in 2007, Southwark Crown Court heard.

item.title: Mary Trump's explosive tell all will now be published on July 14 - two weeks early
item.description: The publication date for Mary Trump's book - Too Much and Never Enough: How My Family Created the World's Most Dangerous Man - will be two weeks earlier than expected.

item.title: Donald Trump attacks New York and Chicago over July 4 violence
item.description: President Trump went after New York and Chicago in a series of tweets after gun violence gripped both Democrat-run cities over the Fourth of July weekend.

item.title: Police taser man after two paramedics stabbed in West Midlands
item.description: The crew were called to reports of concern for a man's safety in the Ashmore area of Wolverhampton at around 12.15pm this afternoon and were stabbed inside the property.

item.title: Painting in Queen's collection is altered to include slavery link
item.description: The Queen's portrait of a Battle of Waterloo hero hanging in Windsor Castle has been changed to include his links to slavery. Sir Thomas Picton was also known as 'Tyrant of Trinidad' over torture

item.title: Food writer Jack Monroe accuses David Walliams of 'horrific racism' and 'sneering fatshaming'
item.description: Activist and food writer Jack Monroe has launched a withering attack on David Walliams, labelling the comedian's popular collection of children's stories racist, 'fatshaming nonsense.'

item.title: Swedish government warns authorities to prepare for a coronavirus SECOND WAVE this autumn
item.description: Ministers warn that Sweden could be 'flooded by a second wave of infections' within months after the country rejected lockdown measures (pictured, a graph of Sweden's daily cases).

item.title: Crime gang suspects appear in court after EncroChat busted
item.description: Begin Pupla, 35, Mohammed Sabek, 33, and Philemon Ghezzehey, 35, appeared in Westminster Magistrates' court on Friday. Sabek blew a kiss to his sister as he was taken to the cells.

item.title: Team GB sprinter Bianca Williams says Cressida Dick must quit
item.description: The black athlete said the Scotland Yard commissioner had been silent since footage emerged of police hauling the couple from their Mercedes and handcuffing them in front of their baby.

item.title: 'Hero' neighbour rescues little boy, three, stuck on his house roof after climbing out of window
item.description: Landing Bojang, 30, leaped into action when he spotted the little boy, wearing just a T-shirt, climbing out of an upstairs window onto a bay roof of a house in south London on July 3.

item.title: Woman, 32, fell to death from French theme park rollercoaster
item.description: Elodie Duval, who was at the Parc Saint-Paul theme park near Beauvais for her son Allen's second birthday, slipped over the safety bar of a Formula 1 ride on Saturday.

item.title: Terrifying moment ladder falls off van overtaking at more than 70mph and spins across busy motorway
item.description: Luke Kibble's dashcam recorded the moment he narrowly avoided the section of metal ladder as it spun across the M5 near Tewkesbury in Gloucestershire.

item.title: Chinese man declared dead by medics and cremated shocks his family when he returns home ALIVE
item.description: The 43-year-old from Chongqing, known by his surname Jiao, showed up two months after his family had thrown a funeral service for him and cremated a body taken from a hospital.

item.title: Social media users share hilarious pranks they've played on their work colleagues
item.description: Social media users from around the world shared some hilarious examples of office pranksters in an online gallery collated by Shareably, including planting watercress on a keyboard.

item.title: PG Tips will remove all plastic packaging from its products by next year
item.description: The bags are made from corn starch and were first introduced on a limited range of products in 2018, but this latest move will see all PG Tips teas use these bags.

item.title: £1.7m London home where 'Ghislaine Maxwell groomed model'
item.description: The £1.7million luxury home in Stanhope Mews, South Kensington, London, is where Ghislaine Maxwell is alleged to have groomed an underage British girl.

item.title: Market Harborough invaded by Leicester lockdown escapees
item.description: Leicestershire Police were forced to impose an urgent dispersal order on Market Harborough when alcohol-fuelled disorder erupted on Saturday night.

item.title: Devon woman 'swallowed' by a sofa bed in hilarious video
item.description: Dani Garland, 25, was 'eaten alive' by the sofa bed while making her friend Shay Stock's bed at the holiday park in Kingsbridge, Devon, where they work.

item.title: Happily married couples say sometimes it's GOOD to go to bed angry
item.description: People from around the world took to Twitter to share their tips after writer Jenna Baker, from Texas, asked for submissions in a post marking her own first anniversary.

item.title: Locals slam visitors as caravans arrive at Cornish beauty spots
item.description: Locals in Devon and Cornwall are so enraged by the visitors they have hung a sign up telling visitors to 'f*** off.' (pictured)

item.title: Newborn baby pictured clasping contraceptive coil mother used in failed bid to stop pregnancy
item.description: A baby in Vietnam was pictured holding onto the contraceptive coil that failed to stop his mother becoming pregnant, only moments after being born in Hai Phong.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's friend claims 'spoiled and entitled' Prince Andrew 'doesn't know a lot'
item.description: Appearing on Good Morning Britain today, Laura Goldman was asked how much the duke knew about what the convicted paedophile's actions.

item.title: Algae is turning snow on the Italian Alps pink
item.description: Snow on the Italian Alps is turning pink due to an algae known as Ancylonema nordenskioeldii that absorbs sunlight and increases the risk of ice melting.

item.title: China detains professor who criticised Xi over coronavirus
item.description: Prof Xu Zhangrun, an outspoken critic of the government, was taken from his home in suburban Beijing on Monday by more than 20 people, one of his friends said on condition of anonymity.

item.title: Lawyer for Epstein's victims claims more British women have come forward as she blasts Prince Andrew
item.description: The American lawyer representing 16 of Epstein victims, Gloria Allred, has said the Duke of York must 'of course' speak to the US authorities about his friendship with the paedophile.

item.title: A fifth of over-55s feel peer pressured to drink MORE alcohol
item.description: The investigation by independent UK alcohol education charity Drinkaware found that peer pressure is felt by all ages - but impacts older generations in different ways.

item.title: Coronavirus: Empty middle plane seats could HALVE spread risk
item.description: Professor Arnold Barnett, a statistician at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, estimated the risk of transmission on an Airbus 320 or Boeing 737 - two of the most common planes.

item.title: NHS worker and friends attacked and told 'you're in England now' for 'talking too loudly in Polish'
item.description: Anna Rutkowska was drinking at The Kingswood Colliers Wetherspoon in Bristol when a woman (pictured) launched at her friend.

item.title: A FIFTH of the UK's 10.5million coronavirus tests have not been processed
item.description: Official figures show 10.5million tests have been made available, but only eight million have been through labs and completed.

item.title: Delaying a stamp duty cut could freeze the property market
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak is reported to be considering plans to wipe out stamp duty paid on homes bought for less than £500,000 to help boost the economy.

item.title: Man, 87, rescued by helicopter after 7 hours in cold due to fall
item.description: An 87-year-old man from West Yorkshire, who took a fall in his garden found himself stuck out in the cold for seven hours before being rescued by paramedics in Helicopter ER.

item.title: Transgender model Munroe Bergdorf slams JK Rowling as 'dangerous'
item.description: Harry Potter author JK Rowling likened hormone therapy and surgery for transgender young people to 'a new kind of conversion therapy'. Munroe Bergdorf slammed Rowling.

item.title: Beijing's troops remove structures from contested Himalayan valley
item.description: China's People's Liberation Army soldiers were 'seen removing tents and structures' in the Galwan Valley, an Indian army source said Monday.

item.title: Revenge porn threats should be treated as a crime, says charity
item.description: Domestic violence charity Refuge has called on the government to make threats to share revenge porn a punishable offence after a survey of 2,060 people found threats were rising.

item.title: Pret a Manger is to axe 30 stores putting 1,000 jobs at risk
item.description: The UK-based chain is looking to 'reduce headcount across remaining UK shops to reflect lower footfall, rental costs and new safety measures'.

item.title: Woman, 29, with incredible 52.8-inch legs says she loves showing them off
item.description: Rentsenkhorloo 'Ren' Bud, who was born in Mongolia, has some of the longest legs in the world and loves to show them off, but admits she's had trouble finding clothes and shoes that fit in Chicago.

item.title: Woman describes painful withdrawal from eczema medication
item.description: Anita Wong, 36, from Auckland, had to go through a painful withdrawal that took years, after being horrified by the affect of steroids when one eye was permanently damaged.

item.title: The classic British summer! UK braces for three days of rain before temperatures soar
item.description: Much of the country enjoyed its last spells of sunshine today before wet weather is forecast for swathes of England from tomorrow through to Thursday morning when low pressure rumbles in.

item.title: Amazing video shows moment a 12mph tornado hits Canada
item.description: Farmer Gerry Bourgeois stood behind towering metal silos at his farm in Woodrow, Saskatchewan, as he filmed the angry mass of clouds.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Just when you thought 2020 couldn't get any worse - along comes Kanye West
item.description: It was hard to imagine how 2020 could deteriorate any further in America. Then Kanye West stepped forward to metaphorically cry 'HOLD MY BEER, 2020!' and announce he is running for president.

item.title: Genes that raise the risk of dying from Covid-19 'were inherited from NEANDERTHALS'
item.description: Researchers from Germany and Sweden said a genetic sequence which entered the human bloodline through cross-breeding appears to have 'tragic consequences' for people with Covid-19.

item.title: Four may have died due to treatment by rogue breast surgeon
item.description: Deaths of Yvonne Cordon, 39, Shionagh Gough, 73, a purchaser, Marie Pinfield, 49, a divorced police officer (first left), and Deborah Hynes, 51, will be investigated by fresh inquests.

item.title: Coronavirus England: Most children to be removed from shielding
item.description: Dr Jenny Harries, deputy chief medical officer for England, has said children are at 'low risk' from Covid-19 and almost all of them should be able to return to school after the summer.

item.title: Bus driver is left brain dead after he was beaten up for insisting on masks in France
item.description: The alleged attackers tried to board the bus in Bayonne (file photo) on Sunday night without tickets or masks, which are mandatory on public transport across France.

item.title: Woman, 24, stoned to death in Pakistan 'honour killing'
item.description: The body of a 24-year-old woman has been found after she was stoned to death in an honour killing in Pakistan. Her husband Allah Baksh and his brother were arrested and remain in police custody.

item.title: Nando's to reopen 10 restaurants for eat-in diners on Wednesday
item.description: Nando's has announced plans to reopen 10 restaurants across England for diners to eat in, with eateries set to welcome customers from Wednesday after being closed during lockdown.

item.title: Daniel Ricciardo defends six F1 drivers who chose not to kneel before Austrian Grand Prix
item.description: Ferrari's Charles LeClerc, Red Bull's Max Verstappen and 2007 world champion Kimi Raikkonen, were among six who refused to take a knee, moments before the season opening Austrian Grand Prix.

item.title: How the European Royals are enjoying very wholesome summers
item.description: From bike rides to trips to the seaside, Europe's royal families are filling their Instagram feeds with snaps of a summer filled with wholesome activities as they stay closer to home due to coronavirus.

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn's son 'terrorised by violent lookalike of his dad'
item.description: Tommy Corbyn said police arrested a man in March after a swastika was daubed on the window of his CBD shop in Finsbury Park, North London .

item.title: Coronavirus: India passes Russia with third most cases in world
item.description: The health ministry said 697,358 cases had now been recorded, a rise of 24,000 in the last 24 hours, while Russia has just over 681,000 cases.

item.title: Toddler survives being knocked down and run over by a car in Brazil
item.description: A CCTV camera caught the moment that two-year-old Theo dos Reis Santos stepped obliviously in front of a car while his mother looked on in horror in Araguari, Brazil.

item.title: The Luminaries fans baffled by Eva Green's accent and lighting
item.description: The Luminaries viewers continue to be left disappointed with the BBC1 period drama, which has already suffered complaints about its 'confusing' plot and 'difficult to hear' dialogue.

item.title: Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner enjoy rural July 4th weekend
item.description: Ivanka Trump, 38, spent the weekend in an unknown secluded location in the US with her husband Jared Kushner, 39, and their children Arabella, eight, Joseph, six, and Theodore, four.

item.title: Direct flights to Greece from UK to resume from 15 July
item.description: Air routes from the UK to the popular holiday destination can reopen on July 15, a month after they started up for many other European countries.

item.title: Hyena is ripped to pieces by a lion in photos from South Africa
item.description: Extraordinary photos taken in South Africa shows a lion capturing a 144lb hyena before ripping it apart. Photographer Chad Cocking, 36, captured the images while stood only 80 yards away.

item.title: One in five 18th century Londoners caught syphilis, study reveals
item.description: Researchers from the University of Cambridge painstakingly scoured hospital admissions to calculate the rate of syphilis infection for men and women up to the age of 35.

item.title: Husband arrested for murder of disability campaigner wife, 57, was living apart from her for months
item.description: Jackie Hoadley, 57, was found dead in her home in Eastbourne on Sunday after a visitor raised the alarm. Her husband Ray, 62, was arrested by police 25 miles away on suspicion of her murder

item.title: Billionaire Christian Candy plans basement for £150m complex
item.description: Christian Candy also plans to add a £30million mansion containing an 82-foot swimming pool, gym and massage room to his £150million estate in Surrey.

item.title: What happened to Rey Rivera in Netflix's Unsolved Mysteries?
item.description: The first episode of new Netflix series Unsolved Mysteries centres around the 2006 death of 32-year-old newlywed Rey Rivera, who was found dead at a hotel in Baltimore, Marlyand.

item.title: The richest billionaires in 43 US states
item.description: There are 43 billionaires in the US who have been recognized as the wealthiest individuals in their respective states. Jeff Bezos held the top spot for Washington state, beating out Bill Gates (inset).

item.title: UFO investigator spots white orbs in sky during BBC broadcast
item.description: Footage shows two glowing lights (circled) appearing above central London during a BBC broadcast by political correspondent Jonathan Blake outside the Houses of Parliament.

item.title: This Morning viewers hail brave boy with autoimmune condition
item.description: Finley Hill, from Worcestershire, who has Hemophagocytic Lymphohistiocytosis, had chemo to strip him of his immune system, and appeared on This Morning with his mother, Jo.

item.title: Boeing communications chief Niel Golightly resigns over a sexist article
item.description: Boeing Senior Vice President of Communications, Niel Golightly, has resigned from his position after an employee complained about a sexist article he wrote 33 years ago

item.title: Man who killed Helen Bailey charged with first wife's murder
item.description: Ian Stewart was jailed for life at St Albans Crown Court in 2017 after a jury convicted him of killing his 51-year-old partner, who wrote the Electra Brown series of books.

item.title: China accuses UK of 'gross interference' over Hong Kong
item.description: Boris Johnson announced the citizenship move last week after China pressed ahead with imposing a controversial national security law on Hong Kong.

item.title: Unruly Chinese tourist beats a sleeping baby seal with a slipper 'to wake up the animal'
item.description: Footage shows a man shouting 'wake up, wake up' and repeatedly hitting the brown fur seal's head and body while a woman is heard laughing as the mammal desperately runs towards the sea.

item.title: Wi-Fi signals can be hacked by criminals to tell when people are home or not, experts warn
item.description: Internet-connected security cameras that track potential burglars, such as Google's Nest Cam and Amazon's Ring range, can be interfered with by attackers.

item.title: Buck moon wows skywatchers around the world
item.description: The spectacle was also a 'penumbral lunar eclipse', in which the moon passes into the lightest part of the Earth's shadow - the penumbra' - causing the lunar surface to appear to dim ever so slightly.

item.title: Terrifying moment footballer is blasted by lightning bolt that hit his necklace
item.description: A video shows the moment a Russian footballer, 16, is hit by lightning as he kicks a ball into an empty net. Ivan Zaborsky was struck in Orekhovo-Zuevo, near Moscow.

item.title: Female lawyer wins payout in sexual discrimination case
item.description: A 'ballbreaking' female lawyer who accused her bosses of sexism was sacked after complaining she was being paid less than her male colleagues, an East London tribunal has ruled.

item.title: Dozens of overcrowded Spanish beaches are forced to close
item.description: Nearly 30 Costa del Sol beaches had to turn visitors away at the busiest times of the day on Sunday in resorts including Benalmadena.

item.title: Composer Ennio Morricone who wrote the music for The Good, The Bad And The Ugly dies aged 91
item.description: Ennio Morricone, whose scores for movies such as 'The Good, the Bad and the Ugly' made him one of the world's most famous and prolific screen composers, has died aged 91.

item.title: Construction industry starts growing again after lockdown eases
item.description: The PMI index surged to 55.3 last month, up from just 28.9 in May and its record low of 8.2 in April. Anything above 50 on the IHS Markit/CIPS measure represents an increase in activity.

item.title: Theatres might not open this year as ministers unveil £1.6bn bailout
item.description: Culture Secretary Oliver Dowden said it would 'challenging' for pantomime season to happen this Christmas and it will be 'some time' before performances can happen indoors.

item.title: Police are seen cracking down on commuters not wearing face masks
item.description: Officers were today dispatched to London's Underground stations where they were seen confronting travellers not wearing masks.

item.title: Kate Middleton pays tribute to Princess Diana in deep blue £525 Beulah London gown
item.description: Kate Middleton, 38, donned a deep blue £525 Beulah London gown reminiscent of an outfit worn by Princess Diana as she visited the Queen Elizabeth Hospital in King's Lynn yesterday.

item.title: Chinese city issues epidemic warnings for the PLAGUE
item.description: Bubonic plague, known as the 'Black Death' in the Middle Ages, is one of the most devastating diseases in history, having killed around 100million people. The new case was found in Inner Mongolia.

item.title: Beauty therapists claim governments decision not to open salons is 'disrespectful and lazy'
item.description: Beauty therapist Teresa Tarmey, from London claimed on This Morning that her salon is 'geared up like a hospital', and said was infuriated to see Boris Johnson laughing about the issue in parliament.

item.title: BBC podcaster Deborah James reveals her friend, 31, died of cancer 'too soon' due to COVID
item.description: Kelly Smith, a 31-year-old mother-of-one from Macclesfield, Cheshire, had restarted chemotherapy shortly before lockdown but had it stopped in March. She died in June.

item.title: Head teacher admits murdering wife and her company director lover in New Year's Day double killing
item.description: Rhys Hancock, 40, admitted at Derby Crown Court this morning murdering both his ex wife Helen, 39, and her new partner Martin Griffiths in the horrific double killing on New Year's Day

item.title: Head teacher admits murdering wife and her company director lover in New Year's Day double killing
item.description: Rhys Hancock, 40, admitted at Derby Crown Court this morning murdering both his ex wife Helen, 39, and her new partner Martin Griffiths in the horrific double killing on New Year's Day

item.title: Baboons cradle their babies in their left arms just like humans do
item.description: French researchers studied 44 olive baboons and found that mothers hold their babies in their left arm around 67 per cent of the time, the same distribution as seen in humans.

item.title: TikTok star gains legions of fans with her hilarious 'Deaf Kardashian series'
item.description: Scarlet May, 19, from Washington DC, has gained over 484,000 followers on TikTok and wracked up millions of views on her hilarious Deaf Kardashian series on the platform.

item.title: High Street footfall 'down by more than half on Super Saturday'
item.description: The number of people visiting high streets across England on 'Super Saturday' was down by more than half on a year ago despite the reopening of pubs and restaurants.

item.title: Simple hair test 'could tell women how many eggs they have left'
item.description: US and Spanish researchers found 'biologically relevant' levels of anti-Müllerian hormone (AMH) - a marker of fertility - in women's hair samples.

item.title: Piers Morgan insists Kate Garraway's husband Derek remains in a 'critical condition'
item.description: Speaking on Monday's Good Morning Britain, Piers, 55, insisted that the situation is not as positive as people think and said Derek, 52, remains on a 'very slow and uncertain path'.

item.title: Japan launches new 223mph N700S bullet train that can escape to safety in the event of an earthquake
item.description: The N700S - the 's' stands for 'Supreme' - has a top speed of 360kph (223mph), though the line it serves, the Tokaido Shinkansen line, has a maximum operating speed of 285kph (177mph).

item.title: Labour leader Keir Starmer vows to undertake 'unconscious bias training'
item.description: Labour leader Keir Starmer revealed that all party staff will be offered the training as he insisted he does not regret 'taking the knee' in solidarity with Black Lives Matter protests.

item.title: Tom Hanks describes his experience with coronavirus
item.description: Tom Hanks has described his experience of coronavirus after becoming one of the first high profile stars to test positive with the disease.

item.title: Egypt arrests ten doctors and warns health workers to keep quiet about coronavirus
item.description: Security agencies have tried to stifle criticism over president Abdel Fattah el-Sissi's handling of the pandemic, which has caused 76,253 infections and 3,343 deaths in Egypt (pictured, testing in Cairo).

item.title: Only yolk-ing! Mother pranks her son into believing a chick is hatching from an egg in her hand
item.description: The mother moves pieces of cracked shell on top of the egg with her finger in the prank filmed at their home in the UK.

item.title: Residents inside Melbourne's public housing blocks clash with cops
item.description: The new measures ban residents of the Melbourne tower blocks from leaving their homes for five days and have seen people attempting to leave being chased by police officers.

item.title: Incredible images show Osprey diving into water to seize big fish
item.description: Alan Wemyss, 55, captured the dramatic snaps while on an early morning shoot at a bird hide in Aviemore, Scottish Highlands, waiting in silence for the large bird of prey to swoop down.

item.title: Life-long Tory voter Jeremy Clarkson says he could back Labour at next general election
item.description: The former Top Gear presenter said, although he had always voted for the Conservatives, he would consider backing Sir Keir Starmer. He slammed Boris for quoting Greek mythology.

item.title: Fake crowd noise and music will be played at England West Indies cricket Test matches
item.description: Agreements will now have to be made between both teams, on items such as which noise-filling tracks to play out between overs and at other key points in the match.

item.title: Millions of British families 'can't afford to eat healthily'
item.description: The way Britain produces, manufactures, sells and consumes food is a barrier to healthy eating, a report published by the House of Lords Food, Poverty, Health and Environment Committee warned.
item.media:description: A report said the way Britain produces, manufactures, sells and consumes food is a barrier to healthy eating (PA)

item.title: Grandmother, 51, speaks of the 'horrific' abuse she was subjected to
item.description: Helen O'Donoghue, 51, was four when her father, James O'Reilly, 75, of Killeens, Ballynonty, Thurles, in County Tipperary Ireland, started molesting her and was raped by him aged eight.

item.title: Sanitary towel brand Bodyform praised for 'breaking taboos' about the female body
item.description: Social media users from across the UK have praised sanitary towel brand Bodyform for 'breaking taboos' about women's experiences in a 'refreshing' new advert about the female body.

item.title: Coronavirus may have been dormant across the world for YEARS, expert says
item.description: Professor Tom Jefferson, of Oxford University, said traces of Covid-19 have been found in sewage samples from Spain, Italy and Brazil which pre-date its discovery in China.

item.title: Dermatologist reveals the WORST skincare trends
item.description: Dr Shah, from the US, posted a series of videos to his TikTok page, showing why those who want clear skin shouldn't fall for expensive skincare fads including using CBD oil.

item.title: County lines gangs disguised young drugs mules as nurses and Deliveroo workers
item.description: Liverpool drug barons masterminded a scheme where young runners would disguise as essential workers to smuggle hard drugs without arousing suspicion.

item.title: British airline captain is accused of killing his baby daughter
item.description: Airbus 330 pilot Mohamed Barakat allegedly beat his young wife Madina Abdullayeva (pictured together)before fatally injuring his one-year-old child Sofia after an all-night drinking session in Almaty.

item.title: Mother-in-law slammed for asking to wear bride's wedding dress
item.description: An anonymous woman, who lives in Portugal, took to Facebook group 'That's It I'm Wedding Shaming ' to rant about her mother-in-law, who has asked to borrow her wedding dress on her own big day.

item.title: Man shot dead by 'moped gunmen' in north London is named as 22-year-old eldest of five brothers
item.description: Imani Allaway-Muir, 22, died in an apparently targeted attack in a children's playground on Saturday in Islington, north London.

item.title: Dentist Madeleine Duff shares her top tips and tricks to get white teeth from home
item.description: A celebrity dentist has revealed everything you need to know about teeth whitening - and her top tricks to help you get a perfect smile. Dr Madeleine Duff from Melbourne shared advice.

item.title: Kayla Itsines reveals the three basic exercises she does every morning to wake up
item.description: Kayla Itsines has shared the basic exercises she does every morning as soon as she wakes up - and the small routine she completes at night to wind down.

item.title: Labrador balances partridge chicks on her nose
item.description: Five-year-old labrador Ruby became 'obsessed' with a group of partridge chicks that her owner Jadene Moloy, 23, saved in Thetford, Norfolk, when they were separated from their mother.

item.title: Jamie Oliver urges Boris Johnson to create incentives for healthy food brands
item.description: Celebrity chef Jamie Oliver has asked Prime Minister Boris Johnson to introduce the celebrity chef's plan to fight obesity in the UK, particularly amongst children.

item.title: Elsa McAlonan's Beauty Upgrades: How to master mask-proof lipsticks!
item.description: Elsa McAlonan reveals a selection of the best mask-proof lipsticks. The British beauty expert also shares the beauty tool Jessica Alba uses to life and curl lashes.

item.title: Ringo Starr says The Beatles turned down a £200m reunion gig in 1976 because of a Great White shark
item.description: The drummer, who is 80 on Tuesday, said the iconic band was offered £50million - worth quadruple that in today's money - to reunite six years after their breakup.
